intro: Tarenna elliptica, commonly known as the oval tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
